content:
Jerod & Adam discuss Nvidia's recently announced personal AI supercomputer, Waymo's latest infinite loop, what's involved in getting a "modern" terminal setup, and whether or not AI has gone mainstream... warts & all! :link: https://changelog.am/76

Check out Open Web UI as a front end for ollama.

Connections is friggin’ awesome. Haven’t watched it since I was a kid. My dad taught at a community college and would routinely drop me off at the library while he had to do work and that was one of my favorite shows to watch there. Awesome that it’s on IA.

Andrew O'Brien said:

Connections is friggin’ awesome. Haven’t watched it since I was a kid. My dad taught at a community college and would routinely drop me off at the library while he had to do work and that was one of my favorite shows to watch there. Awesome that it’s on IA.

Agreed. I was glad to find it there as well. I'm starting to watch it with my oldest son.
Has anybody used Emacs shell? Emacs makes a surprisingly excellent terminal
Regarding fear of caves. This is a sad and very scary cave accident. Just reading it made me anxious.

05:57 @Adam Stacoviak The next time you need to batch-rename-sequence hidden files on macOS, two Finder tips: Cmd-Shift-. toggles showing hidden files in finder windows, and if you multiple-select and open the context menu, there is a "Rename..." option that supports a variety of options including replace text and adding an index number!

Nick Reilingh said:

05:57 Adam Stacoviak The next time you need to batch-rename-sequence hidden files on macOS, two Finder tips: Cmd-Shift-. toggles showing hidden files in finder windows, and if you multiple-select and open the context menu, there is a "Rename..." option that supports a variety of options including replace text and adding an index number!

Yea, that's the less fun way.
